definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: This class will be over in a moment, now let's take a nap(break , catnap).
sentences.chinese: 本课时快要竣事，各人可以休息一会儿。

sentences.english: There's a spring in his step, perhaps because he'll be home soon.
sentences.chinese: 他步履轻快，如沐春风，也许是因为他快要回家了。

sentences.english: Some famous scenic spots in the world will disappear , do you kno…
sentences.chinese: 世界上有快要消失的著名景点，知道吗？

sentences.english: The final exams are coming up. We cannot afford to waste even a minute.
sentences.chinese: 快要期终考试了，我们现在一分钟也不能浪费。

sentences.english: Price is soaring. If it goes on like this, we shall not be able to keep the pot boiling.
sentences.chinese: 物价直线上升，这样子下去，我们都快要揭不开锅了。

sentences.english: He had almost touched the wild horse.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎快要挨到这匹野马了。

sentences.english: Our current contract is about to expire, and we'll need to discuss a one.
sentences.chinese: 欧文们现孕合同快要期铭滤，需要再谈一各新合维。

sentences.english: Man, I am getting to sound as absurd as Zhang Jiehai himself.
sentences.chinese: 老兄啊，我听起来就快要和张结海一样荒谬了。

sentences.english: Even my always "cool" daddy was almost burst into tears and he gave me a very warm hug.
sentences.chinese: 连一向很“酷”的爸爸也快要哭了，还抱了抱我。

sentences.english: The tops of the beggar's shoes had worn so thin that his toes were poking through.
sentences.chinese: 叫化子的鞋帮磨得很薄，脚趾头快要出来了。

sentences.english: Going slower and slower in the lane, my car was almost sticking to the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 车在通道上越走越慢，车身快要贴住峭壁了。

sentences.english: Your head is knocking the headboard and you feel it might blow off?
sentences.chinese: 你的头一直撞到床头板你感觉它快要炸开？

sentences.english: He jeopardized his life to save the drowning child.
sentences.chinese: 他冒着生命危险挽救那个快要淹死的孩子。

sentences.english: The company is on the verge of insolvency.
Go on a “staycation” Even though summer is ending, your ability to relax should not.
sentences.chinese: 即使夏天快要结束了，但你休闲的功夫不能下降。

sentences.english: The driver tooted his horn as he approached the bend.
sentences.chinese: 开车的人在快要转弯时按响了喇叭。

definition: soon/in a moment/to look on as sth happens
in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
in a short while/all at once/all of a sudden
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
